channel.title: Moparscape General Discussion
channel.description:
The intent of this post is to create a discussion of which aspects are missing in our very community. As you can see, our community is being degraded everyday, and, even if we think we are growing everyday, there are still aspects in every little thing that is still need to be discussed. But I, will leave this question for you to think, even knowing that I am acknowledged of the issues of this community.
-[i][b]What you don't most like in Moparscape community? How do you think that would be a good way to fix it?[/b][/i]
Remembering that this question englobes every session of the forums : Servers, Tutorials, the Users, Downloads Section, Rep Points, Moparscape CMs. It's a general discussion, any question is valid. You will be heard and considered for what you say and do, not for anything else. Please if you come up with a problem, come up with a solution also. I don't want to see people complaining and cussing at each other, and any sign of flaming or conflict may result in a warning, mute, or even bannishment from Moparscape's Forums.

item.title: Moparscape General Discussion
item.dc:creator: @shadow235 shadow235
item.description:
@shadow235 wrote:

[quote=“issler, post:5, topic:95355”]The problem is that moderators not always do their job, most of them just want respect, which they don’t deserve for not doing their tasks.[/quote]One problem is Moparisthebest only selects g-mods from moparisthebest.com, They don’t care about this forums too much

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape General Discussion
item.dc:creator: @issler issler
item.description:
@issler wrote:

The problem is that moderators not always do their job, most of them just want respect, which they don’t deserve for not doing their tasks.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape General Discussion
item.dc:creator: @shadow235 shadow235
item.description:
@shadow235 wrote:

[quote=“issler, post:3, topic:95355”]I believe if admins were more picky about people flaming each other. We really should have a “trash can” session to dump our locked and useless posts, or even an off-topic board would reduce spamming about useless stuff.[/quote]They appointed all those moderators for that job. Maybe they should have an administrator just assigned to delete useless topics.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape General Discussion
item.dc:creator: @issler issler
item.description:
@issler wrote:

I believe if admins were more picky about people flaming each other. We really should have a “trash can” session to dump our locked and useless posts, or even an off-topic board would reduce spamming about useless stuff. We have to remember not everyone is obligated to colaborate with moparscape development, some people are just here to play, and we have to respect this.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape General Discussion
item.dc:creator: @shadow235 shadow235
item.description:
@shadow235 wrote:

What I don’t like? The fact that some people are just mean, Everyone was a ‘noob’ as we call it, What to improve it? Add a general section or a “spam thread” That would reduce some spam.

Edit: We also need to get around all these lazy people.

Read full topic
